image.altText: A woman dressed in a protective helmet lays under stalactites in a cave

props.synopsis: It was an adventure into the unknown. From the surface all that could be seen was a small opening. The ABC has been given exclusive access to newly-discovered caves on South Australia's Kangaroo Island.

title.children: Phoenix cave 'rises from the ashes' amid discovery after KI bushfires

image.altText: A collage of photos of Alice Wilkinson with friends and family, centered on a large black and white photo of Alice.

props.synopsis: Alice Wilkinson loved music and was the life of the party. Her death has prompted her family to help others who might be struggling.

title.children: Alice took her own life at 13. Now her family is fundraising to help others

image.altText: A man in a plaid yellow shirt, glasses and face mask walks out of court being questioned by reporters.

props.synopsis: An unqualified massage therapist who sexually abused more than 60 women left his victims with "trauma" and "severe psychological harm", a court has heard. Warning: This story contains descriptions of sexual abuse.

title.children: Victims tell court of trauma inflicted by Adelaide massage therapist

image.altText: Hands holding a purple-cover report held close to the body

props.synopsis: The South Australian government has committed more than $600 million over a decade to reduce the prevalence of — and protect the victims of — domestic, family and sexual violence, in response to a landmark royal commission earlier this year.

title.children: Domestic violence royal commission prompts $674 million response

image.altText: A hand dropping very fine, dry soil.

props.synopsis: The federal government is introducing new low-interest loans for drought-affected farmers and algae-impacted fishers, but some are worried it doesn't go far enough.

title.children: Farmers and fishers offered lifeline as government expands loans

image.altText: Ashton Hurn talks to the media while flanked by five other ministers

props.synopsis: South Australia's new Liberal leader Ashton Hurn unveils a "streamlined" shadow cabinet, just 99 days out from the next state election.

title.children: New SA Liberal leader unveils shadow cabinet

image.altText: Ashton Hurn looks to the right of screen in front of six microphones

props.synopsis: Only days after taking her party's top job, Liberal leader Ashton Hurn is under pressure on a key election promise.

title.children: Labor tries to end Ashton Hurn's 'honeymoon' early

image.altText: A police officer in uniform surrounded by cameras in front of dark glass doors

props.synopsis: South Australia's top cop has taken on an extra role, joining the Adelaide Football Club's board of directors.

title.children: Adelaide Crows appoint Police Commissioner Grant Stevens to club's board

image.altText: A man standing over a map and soil samples.

props.synopsis: The processing market is dominated by China, but Australia is building its capabilities in an attempt to boost the domestic industry.

title.children: First Australian rare earth processing facility under construction

image.altText: A photo of Chris Robertson whose death is being treated as murder.

props.synopsis: Police have arrested a 30-year-old man for the alleged murder of Adelaide father-of-two Chris Robertson, who was found dead in a Lonsdale workshop in September.

title.children: Police arrest man for alleged murder of father-of-two Chris Robertson

image.altText: A Public Service Association rally in Adelaide's CBD.

props.synopsis: Strike action involving prison officers has again escalated, forcing the closure of SA's major courts and causing disruptions to case hearings, which will now be rescheduled.

title.children: SA courts close amid escalating dispute over prison staff pay

image.altText: A pair of hand hold two extra-large strawberries.

props.synopsis: Seasonal conditions are leading to big berries this summer, with the fruit on the larger side in some regions because of a wetter spring.

title.children: Supersized strawberries fill supermarket shelves

image.altText: A man with grey shoulder-length hair and beard gestures with his hand, a woman withe blonde hair stands behind him

props.synopsis: Authorities say the "best signs" in a "long time" have been observed in the latest round of monitoring of the state's algal bloom crisis.

title.children: 'Best signs we've seen': SA algal testing shows positive signs ahead of peak summer period

image.altText: A midddle-aged, dark-haired man gives the thumbs up while standing before the media underneath an awning.

props.synopsis: Jeffrey Purse says a court's decision to dismiss an appeal by his son's killer offers "some justice" for his family, as the search for Michael Purse's remains continues.

title.children: Father's relief as son's murderer loses appeal against conviction

image.altText: Susan Close in a red top speaks into a microphone in front of large glass windows

props.synopsis: South Australia's former deputy premier Susan Close has called out what she describes as "extreme" socio-economic segregation in Australian schools.

title.children: Australia's education system is out of step, former SA deputy premier says

image.altText: King Charles wearing a suit looks directly at the camera.

props.synopsis: King Charles III has revealed his cancer treatment will be reduced in the new year, describing the milestone as a "blessing" and testament to "remarkable" medical advances.

title.children: King Charles gives cancer treatment update

image.altText: Aged care

props.synopsis: The reforms have unleashed a wave of confusion and despair amongst hundreds of thousands of elderly Australians, from those wanting care to those who already have it.

title.children: 'No worse off?' Aged care reforms unleash wave of confusion and despair

image.altText: Albanese Wells AFL

props.synopsis: A spotlight on sports minister Anika Wells prompts fresh scrutiny of the rules about the expenses politicians can claim, including to attend big-ticket sporting events and concerts.

title.children: When can politicians bill taxpayers to attend box-office events?

image.altText: Jared Kushner looks on during a swearing-in ceremony.

props.synopsis: The dramatic escalation in the fight for Warner Bros is one of the biggest in recent corporate memory, drawing an unlikely cast of celebrities and business figures including Jared Kushner.

title.children: Netflix was set to buy Warner Bros Discovery, then came the torpedo

image.altText: Volunteer Malia Sykes crying at a parliamentary inquiry

props.synopsis: Witnesses have told an inquiry into modern slavery that migrant workers are being exploited in the nation's blueberry capital.

title.children: Migrant workers treated 'like pigs' amid claims of modern slavery

image.altText: A composite image showing three authors and their book covers

props.synopsis: An exciting Australian debut, a bevvy of award-winning literary fiction and more than one heart-wrenching memoir are among our critics' favourite reads of the year.

title.children: The 14 books our critics couldn't put down in 2025

image.altText: young woman in mosh pit wearing a cap and sunnies snaps a selfie with her friend.

props.synopsis: Australian partygoers are using walking aids to support their ketamine habit at music festivals across the country.

title.children: Drug-fuelled partygoers using walking sticks to help when they're 'gacked'

image.altText: A green matcha latte in a black mug with rosetta latte art.

props.synopsis: As Japanese matcha producers struggle with the surge in demand, the industry is facing another problem — counterfeit matcha.

title.children: The battle to trademark matcha as counterfeits from outside Japan rise

image.altText: Kate Winslet and Emma Thompson in 1800s-style dress, wearing bonnets and looking downcast.

props.synopsis: Sense and Sensibility was marketed "chick flick". But this 90s re-imagining of Sense and Sensibility starring British powerhouse Emma Thompson was more than just a bubbly romance.

title.children: How Emma Thompson made history with Sense and Sensibility

props.synopsis: Every question has only two options: one is right and the other is wrong. You have an even chance of guessing correctly each time.

title.children: ABC 50/50 quiz: This week we're testing your knowledge on The Simpsons, Gremlins and fruit

image.altText: Black & white photo of Patti Smith in open shirt, jacket draped over left shoulder, leering out from cover of debut album Horses

props.synopsis: The power and importance of Horses, the seminal debut of punk-poet Patti Smith, still lingers five decades after its release.

title.children: Patti Smith’s Horses, the timeless debut that rewrote rock, turns 50

image.altText: Kaylee McKeown points to her eyes

props.synopsis: Swimming stepped out of its tried and trusted format in a novelty, multi-event competition in Brisbane on Friday night. And judging by the response, it was an enormous success.

title.children: 'People are looking for this': Swimming's revolution begins with a pumping party

image.altText: Tim Tszyu and Anthony Velazquez face off

props.synopsis: The stage is set for Tim Tszyu's make-or-break showdown against Anthony Velazquez, with the Australian superstar's team accused of sabotage.

title.children: Tszyu camp accused of sabotage and 'cancelling' opponent's flight

image.altText: A man wearing a hard hat standing with arms crossed in front of a drill rig in bushland.

props.synopsis: The money being spent on drilling for gold has increased 45 per cent in the past 12 months.

title.children: Record gold prices drive Australian exploration boom

image.altText: A bouquet of roses in a shop.

props.synopsis: The Australian government says it plans to stop treating imported flowers with glyphosate, but local growers are not happy and are raising biosecurity concerns.

title.children: Flower growers see red over glyphosate import rule change

image.altText: A young woman poses for a photo on a walking track near coastal area.

props.synopsis: A renewed five-day search for missing Belgian tourist Celine Cremer will take place from Saturday in Tasmania's north-west.

title.children: 'Everyone wants an answer': Renewed search for missing Belgian tourist

image.altText: Two men with their arms around each another stand by an LED sign that says "No pedestrian access"".

props.synopsis: Gordon Plath thought he was one of the lucky ones when he escaped a bushfire that swept through Koolewong on the New South Wales Central Coast last weekend — but then he found himself in a stand-off with his insurer.

title.children: Resident takes insurer to task over rejected bushfire claim and wins

image.altText: A red and white helicopter hovering in a blue sky.

props.synopsis: They are an eclectic mix but this diverse fleet of helicopters, water bombers and planes is ready to protect south-eastern Australia.

title.children: The firefighting aircraft protecting you this bushfire season

image.altText: A teen with hat on backwards sits on the couch.

props.synopsis: Social media can help at-risk youth connect with support services, so what impact will the federal government's under-16s ban have on those community hubs?

title.children: Youth hub staff warn social media ban could have unintended consequences

image.altText: A blonde woman is mobbed by reporters as she walks down a street.

props.synopsis: The controversial adult content creator has faced court for flouting the resort island's road rules.

title.children: British porn star Bonnie Blue deported from Bali after 'Bang Bus' case
